citation.article-title: Phenotypic and phylogenetic characterization of some unknown coryneform bacteria isolated from bovine blood and milk: description of Sanguibacter gen.nov.

p.s: Sanguibacter (San.gui.baćter. M.L. masc.n. Sangubacter a blood rod)
Cells consist of Gram-positive, motile, irregular shaped short rods.

Acid is produced from amygdalin, L-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentibiose, glucose, glycogen, glycerol, lactose, D-lyxose, maltose, melibiose, D-mannose, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, sucrose, D-turanose, trehalose and D-xylose.
Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, inositol, melezitose, L-sorbose, xylitol or D-tagatose.
Cellulose and Tween 80 are not hydrolysed.
The long-chain cellular fatty acids are primarily of the straight-chain saturated and anteiso-methyl branch chain types; iso-methyl branch chain acids are present in small amounts.
The cell wall murein is type (A4α L-Lys-Ser-Glu).
The G + C content of DNA is approximately 69-70 mol%.
The type species is Sanguibacter keddieii.
